Description: Large, heavy bronze axe-head: with a circular blade and an angular butt. It is thickly corroded and in poor condition. It has broken in two at the waist and been repaired in modern times with a metal band. One of the rear corners is missing. Traces of textile survive in the corrosion product.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (155)
Condition: incomplete - haft missing, one rear corner broken away, heavily corroded
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
